reviews: The crafting you actually do in 3D  you make the PlayStation 1 version of whatever it is you want, a shovel for example, put it in your inventory, and out pops the 4K version of the 4 bit pixel art you just created. Its so fun, its so creative I love crafting things like this, like theyre LEGOs or something. It makes me feel like I actually put it together and built it myself. And the XFactor of all of this is, that its not Minecraft.bra hrefhttps:www.youtube.comwatchvPVoecRizKyk targetblank rel  habie147abrbrIts not just the stunning visual composition on offer that makes things engaging. Combining alongside the presentation are VRcentric interactions and many little details to be found along the way. The process of gathering and creating is lined with frequent quot;Thats so coolquot; moments to your interactions, which when viewing on a screen might seem superfluous, but they make perfect, vital sense in VR.bra hrefhttps:www.youtube.comwatchvV19AvLDwPzo targetblank rel  Mr VR Voiceabr

reviews: One of the best escape rooms Ive played in VR. Absolutely spectacularbra hrefhttps:www.youtube.comwatchvC8eUXGwizM targetblank rel  Fun With The ClicksabrbrWhere the game really excels is in its atmosphere. reviews: Climbing Everest in Virtual Reality Was More Powerful Than Any Video Gamebra hrefhttps:steamcommunity.comlinkfilterurlhttp:www.vice.comreadclimbingeverestinvirtualrealitywasmorepowerfulthananyvideogame825 targetblank rel noopener  VICEabrbrIf at this point you still think VR is a gimmick, or a fad, its either because you havent tried it at all, or you havent tried the right experience. reviews: Cloudlands VR Minigolf combines the familiar fun and straightforward mechanics of a traditional round of golf with the barrierbreaking power of virtual reality. The levels have the freedom to break free from any course youll ever play in real life, but the beauty is that at the end of the day youre still just playing minigolf so your goals are super clear and execution feels natural.bra hrefhttps:steamcommunity.comlinkfilterurlhttp:uploadvr.comcloudlandsfirstlook targetblank rel noopener  UploadVRabrbrVirtual reality mini golf is my gateway drug; I know, Im as shocked as you are. I didnt expect this demo to be quite as engrossing as it was, but its mini golf, perfected. The physics feel spot on, and the courses are fantastical without being overwhelming. I doubt most folks will get as excited about mini golf as I am theyre wrong, of course, but it is a great indicator of whats to come.bra hrefhttps:steamcommunity.comlinkfilterurlhttp:www.cnet.compicturesgamescomingsoontothehtcvive20165 targetblank rel noopener  CNETabrbrCloudlands is played completely by motions and a button press that is understood instantly; this is something that anyone can pick up and at least try, no matter their knowledge of games or controllers. It felt like the promise of the Nintendo Wii taken all the way to its logical conclusion.bra hrefhttps:steamcommunity.comlinkfilterurlhttp:www.polygon.comfeatures20162210885790valvehtcvivepreviewgames targetblank rel noopener  Polygonabr

Single player, online and local multiplayer, and a course editor allow you to build, share, and play other user created holes. No swing or power meters here, simply swing the club to play. Fully supports HTC Vive and Oculus Touch.

reviews: Island 359 is about one thing, hunting dinosaurs, so if you thought youd kick ass in Jurassic Park then this is going to be the videogame for you. Split into three separate modes, Survival, Mercenary and Arcade, even the introduction to Island 359 doles out plenty of intense action, giving a brief glimpse at the legendary TRex.br55  a hrefhttps:steamcommunity.comlinkfilterurlhttps:www.vrfocus.com201802reviewisland359 targetblank rel noopener  VR FocusabrbrAlmost two years removed from the launch window of the Oculus Rift and HTC Vive, Island 359  a game thats been in Early Access for almost just as long  has evolved from its humble beginnings into a shining example of not only quality VR gaming, but how to improve a project while in Early Access. They iterated on what worked and expanded in areas that were lacking until Island 359 became just as polished as it was ambitious. Its still not for everyone, but fans of tense action games, shooters, and hardcore survival games owe it to themselves to get lost in the lush jungles of Island 359.br8.510  a hrefhttps:steamcommunity.comlinkfilterurlhttps:uploadvr.comisland359fullreview targetblank rel noopener  Uploadabr

reviews: Kartong  Death by Cardboard is one of those VR titles that impressively showcase the imagination of smaller indie studios and why theyre the life blood of VR.bra hrefhttps:steamcommunity.comlinkfilterurlhttps:www.vrfocus.com201804reviewkartongdeathbycardboard targetblank rel noopener  Peter Graham, VRFocusabrbrDefinitely a mustplay You simply never know what is lurking around each corner.bra hrefhttps:youtu.beJb4D9lGoimY targetblank rel  NathieabrbrEverything in Kartong: Death by Cardboard has been meticulously designed to make the player feel tiny and a little bit scared. From the cute but creepy decor, to the large trap elements that would be small items in everyday use, to the constant prying eyes of Sven through his cameras. Not to mention the skulking enemy contraptions that slink around almost every corner. Everything works together seamlessly to create a world that pulls you into its tiny clutches.bra hrefhttps:steamcommunity.comlinkfilterurlhttp:vrthegamers.comkartongdeathbycardboardreviewsneakingaroundchildhoodnightmare.WtfU54hua71 targetblank rel noopener  Arline Groenewald, VRTheGamersabr

reviews: Though only in Early Access, this VR debut from Virtew surpasses many of the more simplistic linear action games Ive seen in recent weeks and months with its active, engaging gameplay. Run of Mydan is a wonderfully breezy and liberating experience... Leaning out of the way of swinging axes and rotating blades while fending off a legion of dronelike enemies had an air of stylish superheroics to it that many superhero VR games cant actually capture ...this could be one of the unexpected champions of VR gaming.bra hrefhttps:steamcommunity.comlinkfilterurlhttps:uploadvr.comrunofmydan targetblank rel noopener  UploadVRabrbrThe thing that stood out for me most is how the developers incorporated so many elements into the environment of the game... if youre looking for an exciting new experience, then I would recommend you give Run of Mydan a try. The game offers an experience that gets your heart pumping as you fend off enemy attacks while dodging blades and trying to get in a few hits for good measure. I think...Run of Mydan might just become one of the goto VR sports titles in the future...br7.810  a hrefhttps:steamcommunity.comlinkfilterurlhttp:vrthegamers.comrunofmydanreviewnewtypeonrailsshooter.WagRMrJJaUk targetblank rel noopener  VR The GamersabrbrFor a game that is still in Early Access, Run of Mydan is as good as we had hopes for...It could become one of the top games in the months to come... While the environments in this game may feel a bit overwhelming at times, the game is done extremely well...Although some users may find the learning curve too steep,pushing through the challenges is more than rewarding.br45  a hrefhttps:steamcommunity.comlinkfilterurlhttps:thevrbase.comrunofmydanreviewonrailshootingatitsfinest targetblank rel noopener  The VR baseabr

Teleport to areas to watch the battle unfold is very impressive and gives a good sense of the scale of the creatures.   Highly recommend this VR game.bra hrefhttps:www.youtube.comwatchvgvRbGGpWzMamp;featureyoutu.be targetblank rel  Dick RamboabrbrStrategic duel card games arent that easy to come by.
